overview.business_description: UK supermarket retailer supplying grocery and general merchandise. Operates through large-format stores and smaller supermarkets. Third largest UK grocer behind Tesco and Sainsbury's.
business_positives: Strong brand recognition in UK grocery market
Scale advantages as third largest UK grocer
overview.fatal_flaw: EBITDA down 24.9% YoY in 3Q25. Recently downgraded by S&P and Fitch to B with negative outlook. $3.8bn maturing Feb 2026 is imminent refinancing risk.
overview.ownership: TDR Capital LLP (Private Equity) via TDR Capital IV fund
overview.recent_news: 3Q25 pre-IFRS 16 adjusted EBITDA declines 24.9% to GBP 204m. Downgraded to B from B+ by both S&P and Fitch (Nov/Dec 2025). Sale-leaseback raised GBP 568m but insufficient to offset weak outlook.

credit_opinion.summary: Asda is a stressed B-rated credit with deteriorating fundamentals. EBITDA down 25% YoY, dual downgrades from S&P and Fitch, and $3.8bn maturing in Feb 2026 create significant refinancing risk. Bonds trading at 91-94 (below par) reflect market concern. TDR Capital ownership adds execution risk. Sale-leaseback provides short-term liquidity but doesn't address fundamental operational challenges.
key_risks: IMMINENT: $3.8bn Sr Secd Notes mature Feb 2026 - refinancing risk
Recent downgrades to B with negative outlook (S&P, Fitch)
UK grocery market highly competitive (Aldi, Lidl pressure)
PE ownership may prioritize distributions over deleveraging

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Bonds at 91-94 (below par) - market pricing distress risk. YTW 9-10% indicates elevated credit risk.
